{{% md %}}

Enable vSphere HA for this cluster. Default:
`false`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHeartbeatDatastoreIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L806">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The list of managed object IDs for
preferred datastores to use for HA heartbeating. This setting is only useful
when `ha_heartbeat_datastore_policy` is set
to either `userSelectedDs` or `allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L813">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The selection policy for HA
heartbeat datastores. Can be one of `allFeasibleDs`, `userSelectedDs`, or
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`. Default:
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHostIsolationResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L820">property <b>haHostIsolationResponse</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haHostIsolationResponse?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The action to take on virtual
machines when a host has detected that it has been isolated from the rest of
the cluster. Can be one of `none`, `powerOff`, or `shutdown`. Default:
`none`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHostMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L826">property <b>haHostMonitoring</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haHostMonitoring?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Global setting that controls whether
vSphere HA remediates virtual machines on host failure. Can be one of `enabled`
or `disabled`. Default: `enabled`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmComponentProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L833">property <b>haVmComponentProtection</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmComponentProtection?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Controls vSphere VM component
protection for virtual machines in this cluster. Can be one of `enabled` or
`disabled`. Default: `enabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmDependencyRestartCondition">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L843">property <b>haVmDependencyRestartCondition</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmDependencyRestartCondition?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The condition used to
determine whether or not virtual machines in a certain restart priority class
are online, allowing HA to move on to restarting virtual machines on the next
priority. Can be one of `none`, `poweredOn`, `guestHbStatusGreen`, or
`appHbStatusGreen`. The default is `none`, which means that a virtual machine
is considered ready immediately after a host is found to start it on.
<sup>\*</sup>

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmFailureInterval">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L849">property <b>haVmFailureInterval</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmFailureInterval?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

If a heartbeat from a virtual machine
is not received within this configured interval, the virtual machine is
marked as failed. The value is in seconds. Default: `30`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMaximumFailureWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L858">property <b>haVmMaximumFailureWindow</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>haVmMaximumFailureWindow?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The length of the reset window in
which `ha_vm_maximum_resets` can operate. When this
window expires, no more resets are attempted regardless of the setting
configured in `ha_vm_maximum_resets`. `-1` means no window, meaning an
unlimited reset time is allotted. The value is specified in seconds. Default:
`-1` (no window).

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMaximumResets">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L863">property <b>haVmMaximumResets</b></a>

{{% md %}}

The relative path to a folder to put this datastore
cluster in.  This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the
datastore to.  Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of
`foo/bar`, Terraform will place a datastore cluster named
`terraform-datastore-cluster-test` in a datastore folder located at
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path being
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar/terraform-datastore-cluster-test`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterArgs-sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/datastoreCluster.ts#L550">property <b>sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold</b></a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The threshold of reservable
IOPS of all virtual machines on the datastore before storage DRS makes
recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore. Note that this setting should
only be set if `sdrs_io_reservable_percent_threshold` cannot make an accurate
estimate of the capacity of the datastores in your cluster, and should be set
to roughly 50-60% of the worst case peak performance of the backing LUNs.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterArgs-sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/datastoreCluster.ts#L557">property <b>sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold</b></a>

{{% md %}}

The threshold, in
percent, of actual estimated performance of the datastore (in IOPS) that
storage DRS uses to make recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore when
the total reservable IOPS exceeds the threshold. Default: `60` percent.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

cluster in.  This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterState-sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold">

{{% md %}}

The threshold of reservable
IOPS of all virtual machines on the datastore before storage DRS makes
recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore. Note that this setting should

{{% /md %}}
</div>

the root of the type of folder you are creating, and the supplied datacenter.

Information about each of the disks on this virtual machine or

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="NasDatastoreArgs-accessMode">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/nasDatastore.ts#L356">property <b>accessMode</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>accessMode?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Access mode for the mount point. Can be one of
`readOnly` or `readWrite`. Note that `readWrite` does not necessarily mean
that the datastore will be read-write depending on the permissions of the
actual share. Default: `readWrite`. Forces a new resource if changed.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/nasDatastore.ts#L363">property <b>customAttributes</b></a>

{{% md %}}

Map of custom attribute ids to attribute
value strings to set on datasource resource. See
[here][docs-setting-custom-attributes] for a reference on how to set values
for custom attributes.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

{{% md %}}

The [managed object
ID][docs-about-morefs] of a datastore cluster to put this datastore in.
Conflicts with `folder`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="NasDatastoreArgs-folder">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/nasDatastore.ts#L379">property <b>folder</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>folder?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The relative path to a folder to put this datastore in.
This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the datastore to.
Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of `foo/bar`,
Terraform will place a datastore named `terraform-test` in a datastore folder
located at `/dc1/datastore/foo/bar`, with the final inventory path being
`/dc1/datastore/foo/bar/terraform-test`. Conflicts with
`datastore_cluster_id`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="StorageDrsVmOverrideArgs-sdrsIntraVmAffinity">

{{% md %}}

Overrides the intra-VM affinity setting
for this virtual machine. When `true`, all disks for this virtual machine
will be kept on the same datastore. When `false`, Storage DRS may locate

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="StorageDrsVmOverrideState-sdrsIntraVmAffinity">

{{% md %}}

Overrides the intra-VM affinity setting
for this virtual machine. When `true`, all disks for this virtual machine
will be kept on the same datastore. When `false`, Storage DRS may locate
individual disks on different datastores if it helps satisfy cluster
requirements. When not specified, the datastore cluster's settings are used.

{{% /md %}}

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VappContainerArgs-cpuShareLevel">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/vappContainer.ts#L371">property <b>cpuShareLevel</b></a>

{{% md %}}

The CPU allocation level. The level is a
simplified view of shares. Levels map to a pre-determined set of numeric
values for shares. Can be one of `low`, `normal`, `high`, or `custom`. When
`low`, `normal`, or `high` are specified values in `cpu_shares` will be
ignored.  Default: `normal`

{{% /md %}}
</div>

{{% md %}}

determine resource allocation in case of resource contention. If this is set,

{{% /md %}}
</div>

full list of possible values, see [here][vmware-docs-guest-ids]. Default: `other-64`.

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-hostSystemId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1680">property <b>hostSystemId</b></a>

An optional [managed object reference
ID][docs-about-morefs] of a host to put this virtual machine on. See the
section on virtual machine migration for
details on changing this value. If a `host_system_id` is not supplied,

according to any defaults or DRS policies in place.

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-hvMode">

The (non-nested) hardware virtualization setting for
this virtual machine. Can be one of `hvAuto`, `hvOn`, or `hvOff`. Default:

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-ignoredGuestIps">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1693">property <b>ignoredGuestIps</b></a>

<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>ignoredGuestIps?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</pre>

for an available IP address using either of the waiters. Any IP addresses in

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-latencySensitivity">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1701">property <b>latencySensitivity</b></a>

<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>latencySensitivity?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Controls the scheduling delay of the
virtual machine. Use a higher sensitivity for applications that require lower
latency, such as VOIP, media player applications, or applications that
require frequent access to mouse or keyboard devices. Can be one of `low`,
`normal`, `medium`, or `high`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestIpTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1856">property <b>waitForGuestIpTimeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestIpTimeout?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available guest IP address on this virtual machine. This should
only be used if your version of VMware Tools does not allow the
`wait_for_guest_net_timeout` waiter to be
used. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 0.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestNetRoutable">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1865">property <b>waitForGuestNetRoutable</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetRoutable?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Controls whether or not the guest
network waiter waits for a routable address. When `false`, the waiter does
not wait for a default gateway, nor are IP addresses checked against any
discovered default gateways as part of its success criteria. This property is
ignored if the `wait_for_guest_ip_timeout`
waiter is used. Default: `true`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetTimeout?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available IP address on this virtual machine's NICs. Older
versions of VMware Tools do not populate this property. In those cases, this
waiter can be disabled and the
`wait_for_guest_ip_timeout` waiter can be used
instead. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 5 minutes.

{{% /md %}}

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-datastoreClusterId">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1198">property <b>datastoreClusterId</b></a>

{{% md %}}

The [managed object reference
ID][docs-about-morefs] of the datastore cluster ID to use. This setting
applies to entire virtual machine and implies that you wish to use Storage
DRS with this virtual machine. See the section on virtual machine
migration for details on changing this value.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

{{% md %}}

</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-defaultIpAddress">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1213">property <b>defaultIpAddress</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>defaultIpAddress?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The IP address selected by Terraform to be used with
any [provisioners][tf-docs-provisioners] configured on this resource.
Whenever possible, this is the first IPv4 address that is reachable through
the default gateway configured on the machine, then the first reachable IPv6
address, and then the first general discovered address if neither exist. If
VMware tools is not running on the virtual machine, or if the VM is powered
off, this value will be blank.

{{% /md %}}
</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-hostSystemId">

{{% md %}}

An optional [managed object reference
ID][docs-about-morefs] of a host to put this virtual machine on. See the

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-ignoredGuestIps">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1297">property <b>ignoredGuestIps</b></a>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-imported">

state has been migrated from a previous version of the resource. It

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-latencySensitivity">

Controls the scheduling delay of the
virtual machine. Use a higher sensitivity for applications that require lower

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-shutdownWaitTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1445">property <b>shutdownWaitTimeout</b></a>

{{% /md %}}
</div>

<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestIpTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1498">property <b>waitForGuestIpTimeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestIpTimeout?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available guest IP address on this virtual machine. This should
only be used if your version of VMware Tools does not allow the
`wait_for_guest_net_timeout` waiter to be
used. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 0.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestNetRoutable">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1507">property <b>waitForGuestNetRoutable</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetRoutable?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

Controls whether or not the guest
network waiter waits for a routable address. When `false`, the waiter does
not wait for a default gateway, nor are IP addresses checked against any
discovered default gateways as part of its success criteria. This property is
ignored if the `wait_for_guest_ip_timeout`
waiter is used. Default: `true`.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
<h3 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestNetTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/ad67bef33791510c00e5f3da0806f63a0ebecd27/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1516">property <b>waitForGuestNetTimeout</b></a>
</h3>
<div class="pdoc-member-contents">
<pre class="highlight"><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetTimeout?: <a href='/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</pre>
{{% md %}}

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available IP address on this virtual machine's NICs. Older
versions of VMware Tools do not populate this property. In those cases, this
waiter can be disabled and the
`wait_for_guest_ip_timeout` waiter can be used
instead. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 5 minutes.

{{% /md %}}
</div>
</div>

</h3>

{{% md %}}

The relative path to a folder to put this datastore in.
This is a path relative to the datacenter you are deploying the datastore to.
Example: for the `dc1` datacenter, and a provided `folder` of `foo/bar`,
Terraform will place a datastore named `terraform-test` in a datastore folder
